hackathon-description-text: Welcome to the HackBU hackathon, Binghamton University's third annual hackathon! We hope you're excited for a great weekend! After 12:00 p.m. on Saturday, all teams are allowed to start working on their hacks. Hacking will end at 12:00 p.m. on Sunday morning, with all submissions due then.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Dell Venue 8 tablets, provided by MLH (1 per winner)
Amazon FireTV Stick/Google Chromcast (1 per winner)
1 TB HDD, provided by Amazon (1 per winner)
Domain.com swag bag, including SparkFun RedBoard
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Best Domain Name Registered with Domain.com

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Awarded to the team solving a common problem in the most unconventional way, which reflects GE’s commitment to solving complex problems at a global scale.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=85 Murray Hill Rd, Vestal, NY 13850, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the product functional? Does it accomplish its goal? Does it work as is, or does it require additional resources (code or data)? How easy is the product to use? How does the product look and feel?
How technically difficult was the hack to implement? How much did it rely on open source libraries and APIs?
Is this a creative solution to a problem? Is this a new solution to a problem? Does the product innovate on design, user experience, or technical solutions?

hackathon-location-address: 85 Murray Hill Rd, Vestal, NY 13850, USA
hackathon-location-description: SUNY Binghamton — ITC Engineering & Science Building
